docs.snippet: The absence of the Russian track and field team is unlikely to hurt NBC’s prime-time ratings for several reasons, among them the likelihood that the removal of a major rival might help the United States win more medals....
docs.lead_paragraph: The absence of the Russian track and field team is unlikely to hurt NBC’s prime-time ratings for several reasons, among them the likelihood that the removal of a major rival might help the United States win more medals.
docs.abstract: International Assn of Athletics Federations ban of Russia from competition in track and field events at Summer Olympics will have little impact on viewing audience; NBC's prime-time Olympic coverage is generally dominated by gymnastics and swimming, and is not overly reliant on track and field events.

headline.main: Russia’s Track Team Will Miss the Olympics. American Audiences? Not Likely.
headline.print_headline: Russian Track Team to Miss Olympics. American Audiences? Not Likely.

docs.lead_paragraph: Exactly 53 percent of the Mets’ runs this season have come from home runs, according to the Elias Sports Bureau, an inconsistent offense that has feast-or-famine tendencies.
docs.abstract: Mets lag behind most teams in National League in terms of offense, but they excel when it comes to home runs; general manager Sandy Alderson says home runs aren't enough to support strong offense over season.
